definitions: method for detecting underwater objects using transmitted and reflected sound waves
examples: The submarine used sonar to navigate through dark waters
Dolphins possess natural sonar abilities called echolocation

definitions: instrumental composition typically consisting of three or four movements in contrasting forms
examples: Beethoven's Moonlight Sonata remains one of his most popular pieces
The pianist practiced the difficult sonata for weeks before performing

definitions: short musical composition with words intended to be sung
melodious sounds produced by certain birds as territorial or mating calls
examples: She wrote a beautiful song about her childhood memories
The new song topped the charts within a week
The robin's morning song woke us at dawn
Each bird species has its own distinctive song pattern

definitions: small perching bird with a melodious song, especially of the oscine group
examples: The garden attracted many colorful songbirds during spring migration
Cardinals and finches are common songbirds in North America

definitions: book containing a collection of songs with their lyrics and musical notation
examples: The church choir used the same songbook for decades
She bought a Broadway songbook to learn show tunes

definitions: person who writes the words or music for songs, especially popular songs
examples: Bob Dylan became famous as both a songwriter and performer
The talented songwriter penned hits for numerous artists

definitions: poem of fourteen lines using formal rhyme schemes, typically about love or nature
examples: Shakespeare wrote 154 sonnets exploring themes of love and time
The student struggled to maintain iambic pentameter in her sonnet

definitions: informal term used to address a young man or boy, often patronizingly
examples: Listen here, sonny, that's not how we do things
The old sailor called every young recruit sonny

definitions: black powdery substance consisting of carbon particles from incomplete combustion
examples: The chimney sweep removed years of accumulated soot
Soot from the factory smokestacks covered the nearby buildings

definitions: something given to pacify or quiet someone, typically seen as inadequate
piece of bread or similar food dipped in liquid before eating
examples: The small raise was merely a sop to quiet employee complaints
Critics called the reform a sop to special interests
He dipped a sop of bread into the savory gravy
Medieval diners often ate sops soaked in wine or broth

definitions: quality of being sophisticated, showing great knowledge, experience, or complexity in design
examples: The restaurant's menu showed culinary sophistication rarely seen locally
Her sophistication impressed everyone at the diplomatic reception

definitions: student in the second year of high school or college in the United States
examples: As a sophomore, she decided to change her major to biology
The sophomore class organized the annual spring fundraiser

definitions: highest singing voice, typically that of a woman or young boy
singer with a soprano voice, especially a female opera singer
examples: The aria was written for a coloratura soprano voice
Her clear soprano soared above the other voices in the choir
The famous soprano performed at opera houses worldwide
They hired a soprano to sing at the wedding ceremony

definitions: person who claims or is believed to have magic powers, especially using supernatural forces
examples: The ancient sorcerer was said to control the weather
In the fantasy novel, the sorcerer battled dark forces

definitions: use of magic powers, especially those deriving from evil spirits or supernatural forces
examples: The villagers accused her of practicing sorcery against her enemies
Ancient texts described elaborate rituals of sorcery and divination

definitions: raw or painful spot on the body, typically an inflamed or infected area
examples: The hiker developed painful sores from his ill-fitting boots
She applied antiseptic cream to the sore on her arm

definitions: social organization for female students in a college or university, typically with Greek letters
examples: She joined a sorority during her freshman year at college
The sorority raised thousands of dollars for local charities

definitions: feeling of deep distress caused by loss, disappointment, or other misfortune
examples: She expressed her sorrow at the passing of her mentor
The poem captured the profound sorrow of wartime separation

definitions: category of things or people having common characteristics
process of arranging things systematically in groups or categories
examples: What sort of music do you prefer listening to?
This sort of behavior won't be tolerated here
The postal workers did a daily sort of incoming mail
Computer algorithms can perform complex data sorts quickly

definitions: action or process of arranging things into groups according to shared characteristics
examples: The sorting of recyclables happens at the processing facility
Mail sorting requires attention to zip codes and addresses

definitions: spiritual or immaterial part of a human regarded as immortal
person's moral or emotional nature or sense of identity
style of music expressing deep feeling, originating in African American gospel
examples: Many religions believe the soul continues after death
The tragedy seemed to crush her very soul
Not a soul was present when the accident occurred
She's a kind soul who helps everyone she meets
Aretha Franklin was known as the Queen of Soul
The band plays classic soul from the 1960s

definitions: vibrations that travel through air or another medium and can be heard
narrow stretch of water forming an inlet or connecting two larger bodies
examples: The sound of thunder echoed through the valley
Ultrasonic sounds are beyond human hearing range
Long Island Sound separates the island from Connecticut
The ship navigated carefully through the sound

definitions: thin wooden board in a musical instrument that vibrates to amplify sound
examples: The piano's soundboard cracked, affecting its tone quality
Guitar soundboards are typically made from spruce or cedar

definitions: measurement of the depth of water, typically using a weighted line or sonar
examples: The captain ordered regular soundings in the unfamiliar harbor
Modern ships use electronic soundings rather than lead lines

definitions: recorded music accompanying and synchronized to the images of a motion picture
examples: The movie's soundtrack won an Academy Award for best score
She bought the soundtrack album after seeing the film

definitions: liquid dish made by combining meat, vegetables, or legumes with water or stock
examples: She made homemade chicken soup to help with his cold
The restaurant offers a different soup special each day

definitions: place, person, or thing from which something comes or can be obtained
person who provides information to a journalist or researcher
examples: The river's source lies high in the mountains
Renewable energy sources are becoming more affordable
The journalist refused to reveal her sources
Primary sources provide firsthand historical evidence

definitions: bread made from dough fermented using naturally occurring lactobacilli and yeast
examples: San Francisco is famous for its tangy sourdough bread
She maintained a sourdough starter for over ten years

definitions: direction toward the point of the horizon directly opposite north
southern part of a country, region, or specified area
examples: The compass needle points south toward magnetic south
Birds migrate south for the winter months
He grew up in the South before moving to New York
The south of France attracts millions of tourists annually

definitions: direction or point midway between south and east on a compass
southeastern part of a country, region, or specified area
examples: The storm is moving southeast toward the coast
We traveled southeast through the mountain pass
Southeast Asia includes Thailand, Vietnam, and neighboring countries
The drought affected the entire southeast of the continent

definitions: left-handed person, especially a left-handed pitcher in baseball or boxer
examples: The team's new southpaw pitcher had an impressive fastball
Being a southpaw gave the boxer an advantage against orthodox fighters

definitions: direction or point midway between south and west on a compass
southwestern part of a country, region, or specified area
examples: The plane flew southwest toward its destination
Strong winds blew from the southwest all day
The American Southwest includes Arizona, New Mexico, and surrounding areas
Native American cultures flourished in the southwest

definitions: object kept as a reminder of a person, place, or event
examples: She bought a small souvenir from each country she visited
The gift shop sold various souvenirs featuring local landmarks

definitions: supreme ruler, especially a monarch who has supreme power over a country
examples: The sovereign ruled the kingdom for over forty years
Queen Elizabeth II was Britain's longest-reigning sovereign

definitions: supreme power or authority, especially of a state to govern itself
examples: The nation fought to maintain its sovereignty against foreign interference
Questions of sovereignty dominated the independence referendum debate

definitions: elected governmental council in the former Soviet Union at local, regional, or national level
examples: Local soviets managed community affairs in the USSR
The Supreme Soviet was the highest legislative body

definitions: adult female pig, especially one that has given birth to piglets
examples: The farmer's prize sow won first place at the county fair
The sow nursed her twelve piglets in the barn

definitions: protein-rich product made from soybeans, used in various food preparations
examples: She substituted soy milk for dairy in her coffee
Soy sauce is essential in many Asian dishes

definitions: plant of the pea family cultivated for its edible beans, widely used for food
examples: Soya cultivation has expanded dramatically in South America
The farmer rotated corn and soya crops annually

definitions: edible seed of the soya plant, used as food and to make oil
examples: Soybeans provide complete protein for vegetarian diets
The United States exports millions of tons of soybeans annually

definitions: health resort offering therapeutic treatments using mineral springs or similar facilities
commercial establishment offering health and beauty treatments or a large bath with jets
examples: They spent a relaxing weekend at a mountain spa resort
The spa offered massages, facials, and aromatherapy treatments
The hotel room included a private spa on the balcony
They installed a spa in their backyard for relaxation

definitions: continuous area or expanse that is free, available, or unoccupied
physical universe beyond Earth's atmosphere containing celestial bodies
interval of time or blank area in text or between objects
examples: The apartment lacks storage space for all our belongings
Please leave enough space between the chairs for walking
Astronauts train extensively before traveling to space
The telescope revealed distant galaxies in deep space
Leave a space between each word when writing
We need more space between meetings to prepare

definitions: vehicle designed for travel or operation in outer space beyond Earth's atmosphere
examples: The spacecraft successfully docked with the International Space Station
Unmanned spacecraft have explored every planet in our solar system

definitions: journey through outer space in a spacecraft, whether manned or unmanned
examples: Commercial spaceflight may soon become available to tourists
Her first spaceflight lasted six months aboard the space station

definitions: person trained to travel in a spacecraft, especially used informally or by children
examples: The children dressed as spacemen for the science fair
Early science fiction often featured spacemen exploring Mars

definitions: spacecraft, especially in science fiction contexts or informal usage
examples: The movie featured an alien spaceship landing on Earth
Children built a cardboard spaceship for imaginative play

definitions: pressurized garment worn by astronauts to survive in the harsh environment of space
examples: The astronaut checked her spacesuit before the spacewalk
Modern spacesuits cost millions of dollars to develop

definitions: arrangement of spaces or gaps between things, especially in text or physical layout
examples: Adjust the line spacing to make the document easier to read
Proper plant spacing ensures adequate sunlight for growth

definitions: tool with a sharp-edged rectangular metal blade for digging
playing card suit marked by black inverted heart-shaped figures with stems
examples: He used a spade to dig holes for the fence posts
The gardener's worn spade had served for twenty years
She held the ace of spades in her poker hand
In bridge, spades rank higher than hearts

definitions: pasta made in long, thin, solid cylindrical strands
examples: She served spaghetti with homemade marinara sauce for dinner
The restaurant specializes in authentic Italian spaghetti dishes
